channel.title: God is omnipotent?
channel.description:
Hey, can someone give me the link of a post this guy PaulT made which contained a link to a website that had huge information about god being omnipotent or not and how they figured that out. Philosophy related.
I've used the search function but haven't found it.

item.title: God is omnipotent?
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:6, topic:283749”][quote author=Ashleyy90 link=topic=375009.msg2826716#msg2826716 date=1245071139]
Hey, can someone give me the link of a post this guy PaulT made which contained a link to a website that had huge information about god being omnipotent or not and how they figured that out.
Philosophy related.

I’ve used the search function but haven’t found it.
[/quote]

Philosophy doesn’t give the right answer 100% of the time. Religion is 100% natural science. Anyone saying that religion is philosophical, admits to the fact that any religion is created by our minds.[/quote]Philosophy is the (eternal?) search to knowledge. There’s a difference between deductive reasoning and inductive reasoning. Deductive reasoning would be: If A = 100% true and B= 100% true, than A+B = 100% true (If my bike is positioned in the garden (A) and it’s raining (B) than my bike gets wet (= 100% true conclusion). Inductive reasoning would be: If you see 100 blue backpacks in a row, than the 101th backpack COULD be aswell blue, but you don’t know that for sure!

So ofcourse philosophy doesn’t give an answer to things like religion… It just gives mankind a reason to think about stuff like that.
Also, if you claim that religion is science, than would there be any scientific proof of a god?

I could not be getting your point, but that’s what I think about philosophy and religion…

EDIT:

SomethingToHide:

Religion was created by our minds.

Fact. Religion was created to keep people dumb.

Read full topic
